results.title: The Domino
results.creator_credit: Robert Stenhouse, Hugh Macdonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: An individual is working happily by himself when he is increasingly interrupted by proliferating bureaucracy that eventually totally thwarts his capacity to work. This animated cartoon is an illustration of any activity that loses its originality or purpose when support services and administration become an end in themselves. An entertainment on a universal theme.

results.title: The Dolphin kick
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Jorhal Pictures
results.brief_description: A swimmer, an underwater camera, and carefully devised teaching demonstrations introduce the new swimming technique known as the dolphin or fishtail kick. Analysing the body movements used in this technique, the film stresses the importance of practice for mastery of this efficient, speedy kick. From this kick, the Butterfly Stroke was developed.

results.title: The Dolmetsch Story. Part 3. Making music
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Fanelodge Productions
results.brief_description: Final part in a three part series. This film is devoted to the music played and recorded in the Dolmetsch family and also in their museum. It captures the authentic sound of various instruments, which include violas, recorders, harpsicords, virginals, octavinas, spinets and fortepianos. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Dolmetsch story. Part 2. Viols and fortepiano
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Fanelodge Productions
results.brief_description: Part two of a three part series. Dr Carl Dolmetsch describes the history of the viola da gamba and demonstrates how it is played. Shows its construction in the Dolmetsch workshops, along with some priceless instruments in their museum. The fortepiano is described and demonstrated and we see a recital by the Dolmetschs and Joseph Saxby. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Dolmetsch story. Part 1. Recorders
results.creator_credit: Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Fanelodge Productions
results.brief_description: Part one of a series of three films. Carl Dometsch, probably the greatest recorder player of all time, is head of the Dolmetsch workshops in Haslemere where many ancient musical instruments have been reconstructed and copied. Dr Dolemetsch describes the history of the recorder and demonstrates the musical qualities of each member of the recorder family. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Doll's house. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Patrick Garland, Hillard Elkins and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film based on Ibsen’s feminist play of the same name. Set in the 1890’s, it concerns a woman’s attempt to find a role in society for herself apart from those of wife and mother. Stars Claire Bloom, Anthony Hopkins, Denholm Elliott, Anna Massey.

results.title: The Dogfish as a vertebrate
results.brief_description: Deals with the Dogfish as a typical vertebrate, illustrating its anatomy in detail. Comparisons with four other types are given; i.e., with newt, lizard, bird and rabbit. Fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds and mammals included in vertebrates; basic plan demonstrated by Dogfish. Alimentary canal has mouth, oesophagus, stomach, intestinal colonic regions; liver and pancreas; also central nervous system, sense organs. Detail from Dogfish; comparisons in the other four types (frog, lizard, bird and rabbit). Skeleton - axial and appendicular - common to all. Respiratory system involves large surfaces for oxygenation of blood - gills, lungs. Ventral position of heart; plans of blood systems. Gills as embryonic vestiges. Urinogenital systems association. Sexual reproduction and separate sexes common to vertebrates; detail for Dogfish (internal fertilization), Frog (external fertilization).

results.title: The Doctor
results.brief_description: Members of the medical profession may specialise in one or perhaps more of the hundreds of branches of medical science, according to their own choice and ability. This doctor is a children’s specialist - a pediatrician - and the film is designed to show both parents and children what a typical day’s work is like for him, in a big hospital, and at his private consulting rooms.

results.title: The division of radiophysics
results.brief_description: Describes the current research work being undertaken by the CSIRO division of Radiophysics, including radio astronomy, moon echoes, radar meteorology, radio-controlled models, rain making, electronic computing, radar aids to navigation, aids to airport control, and upper air investigations.

results.title: The Divided man: commitment or compromise
results.creator_credit: Milosaw Kijawicz, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: An animated film which proves the maxim that one cannot travel two roads at the same time without being diminished. Vascillating from side to side, a man struggles to make a decision. In an effort to make the “perfect” choice he divides himself and travels two paths. However when his two halves attempt to reunite one half has shrunk.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milosaw Kijawicz, Film Polski, Miniature Film Studio and Stephen Bosustow Productions
